Employee Data Class#

This module contains the MariaDB data classes and Pydantic data classes for the employee entity. The MariaDB data classes are used in database queries and transactions. The Pydantic data classes are used in requests to the API for ensuring that data received and sent through requests are valid. For example, creating a new employee record through a request to the API will require a Pydantic employee data class to define the attributes needed to create the employee entity in the database and validate the data that is sent in the request.

class server.lib.data_classes.employee.Employee(employee_id, first_name, last_name, phash, role_id, contact_id, enabled=True)#

Bases: sqlalchemy.orm.decl_api.Base

A MariaDB data class that represents the table structure of the employee table in the database server. This is replicated in the server code to ensure that the data being sent to and received from the database are valid. Do not attempt to manually modify this class or extend it into a subclass.

PasswordHash#
as_detail_dict()#

A utility method to convert the class attributes into a dictionary format. This is useful for representing the entity in a JSON format for a request response.

Returns

Dictionary representation of the data class attributes.

Return type

Dict[str, any]

as_dict()#

A utility method to convert the class attributes into a dictionary format. This web friendly version hides the internal IDs, password hash, and other metadata information.

Returns

Web-safe dictionary representation of the data class attributes.

Return type

Dict[str, any]

id#
class server.lib.data_classes.employee.PydanticEmployeeRegistration(*, plain_password: str, first_name: str, last_name: str, primary_email: str, secondary_email: str = None, role: str, is_enabled: bool = True, enable_notifications: bool = True)#

Bases: pydantic.main.BaseModel

A Pydantic class used to represent an employee entity when creating a new employee record from an HTTP request to the API. Do not try to initialize this class as an independent entity or extend it into a subclass.

class server.lib.data_classes.employee.PydanticEmployeeUpdate(*, plain_password: str = None, first_name: str = None, last_name: str = None, primary_email: str = None, secondary_email: str = None, role: str = None, is_enabled: bool = None, enable_notifications: bool = None)#

Bases: pydantic.main.BaseModel

A Pydantic class used to represent an employee entity when updating an existing employee record from an HTTP request to the API. Do not try to initialize this class as an independent entity or extend it into a subclass.

class server.lib.data_classes.employee.PydanticEmployeesRemoval(*, employee_ids: Union[List[str], str])#

Bases: pydantic.main.BaseModel

A Pydantic class used to represent an employee entity when deleting an existing employee record from an HTTP request to the API. Do not try to initialize this class as an independent entity or extend it into a subclass.
